text: <@UBE37B8JX> has joined the channel
<@U8DQWL9EK> <@UBE37B8JX> this is the document to edit for changes for the page...

<@U8DQWL9EK> Sarah can't make 15.00 this afternoon. She will send us a few other options. It's a bit of a challenge but we're really trying to get on a call before JP (or, actually, before Sarah leaves for Taiwan this Sunday :joy: )
If <@U0D6EPESC> agrees, then I will mail Mijke :slightly_smiling_face:
<@U8DQWL9EK> <@U0D6EPESC> Do you agree? ^^
The main message should in my opinion be; were taking your time and work seriously and are working hard to make this hackathon a reality.

Sounds good, also, mention specifically that we really appreciate the help they offered through Tamara. Plus add some feedback on the presentation (showing that you've seriously read it). I like the addition you've made in the beginning; about specifying that there are different scenarios/stages in life during which people may 'switch' jobs.
Maybe that we are enthusiastic and working on this, and that we'll get back to her as soon as we have a more concrete plan. <@U0ARRNM3R> do you agree?
What shall we say to Mijke? I promised to get back to her this week
<@U8DQWL9EK> <@U0ARRNM3R> i think our next step should be to schedule two meetings: one with jinc to talk about the things <@U8DQWL9EK> mentions, and one with Sarah to get more clarity about the plan
<!channel> What is our next step now? Are we doing this or not?

<@U0ARRNM3R> yes, that is my concern. The amount of work that is expected from our side. Although I see huge advantages when we could organise it together with JINC and Optimus Acorro. Is that maybe a "topic" we could discuss with Florie? NB! Could you plan a meeting with her? :slightly_smiling_face:
Also: joy of coding, 010dev
<@U0ARRNM3R> <@U8DQWL9EK> wait with asking Mijke until we have a clear idea of what we are asking

1. Our meetup 2. Other meetups in Rotterdam 3. Through other hackathons 4. Through Cyberwerkplaats 5. Through Restart maybe 6. Our own networks 7. Our partners networks 8. Other coding courses in town 9. Maybe get info from WeTechRotterdam 10. From 42Workspace 11. Put it on <http://Meetup.com|Meetup.com> << just some first ideas
The question about the hours seems a reasonable one. You could ask them whether they're also considering a financial contribution, but that might be a bit too forward at this point?

root.text: Shall I ask from Mijke about the availability of Tamara and/ or whether they also could support the hackathon to somewhat financially? (a la 500.- voor catering of smthing like that + Tamara?)

text: <@U8DQWL9EK> Just to verify if I understand your mixed feelings correctly. 1. You do believe that it is worth it to organize a hackathon wrt awareness creation and to help promote the product. But 2. you are worried that the amount of work is too much for us to handle?
any ideas about finding hackers?
Shall we ask Sarah whether she can help us finding a sponsor/s from VS?
Shall I ask from Mijke about the availability of Tamara and/ or whether they also could support the hackathon to somewhat financially? (a la 500.- voor catering of smthing like that + Tamara?)
That said, <@U0ARRNM3R> - could you schedule a meeting with Florie from Jinc?
<@U8DQWL9EK> uploaded a file: <https://offcourse.slack.com/files/U8DQWL9EK/F9WS504T0/20180321hackathon_adjusted_birgit.pptx|Hackathon adjusted Birgit.pptx>

Hi, I have mixed feelings about us organising the hackathons. It would definitely help us with awareness creation and it would help us to “promote” the product during and in the aftermath of the hackathons to share knowledge. We should not take it as granted but a lot of “promo” work should be done during the hackathon. 
Secondly, I had a look at Sara’s document. It stands there that the workload from “our” side includes 40-50h in total (per event??). If that’s the time needed per event, I think we can handle it (with the help from all of us and Tamara – we have to agree with Mijke how many hours Tamara is available and set up a clear task division plan). 
What worries me is that we need to recruit sponsors on our own. As nobody of us has experience with recruiting sponsors, it’s going to cost us a lot of time. BUT if we could get help from Jinc with finding sponsors to cover the costs (venue, catering, extra voor Stichting Offcourse – from companies that share our ideology) we would be already half way. How many sponsors do we need to consider it a success?
Another thing is to figure out the challenges and/ or the theme of the event. We could do this by asking sponsors to create their own challenge or we can think about a theme and find challenges through this method. Working out challenges would cost us time though. 
Futher, finding hackers is up to us aswell. Maybe we could ask help for this from Mijke? Of in collaboration with Jinc? (for youth). Do we have our own network? How many hackers/ teams do we aim to consider it a successful event?
Also, we need to think about what can we offer to the sponsors and what are the prices for the hackers? As we haven’t organised any hackathon before, we need to scale our proposal high in order to attract sponsors and hackers (reputation, desire to participate). 
All in all, I think we all agree that organising an hackathon is valuable for Offcourse. Before ee decide whether we can proceed NOW (in terms of human and financial capital) YES or NO, we should clear a couple of things:
(1)	Whether we can recruit sponsors via Jinc?! 
(2)	Whether Sarah knows sponsors from America?
(3)	How many hours per week/ project is Tamara available?
(4)	Can Optimus Acorro support us financially? (challenge organiser with “jobswitch” idea)
(5)	Can we recruit enough hackers/ teams via Jinc, Sara, own network, or other way?
NB! See also hackathon idea from Mijke/ Tamara. I made some adjustments in red.
<@U0ARRNM3R> the answer to question 1 is yes for me. Still think it can help us a lot with partnerships and expanding community.
If you agree to the above, let's set some deadlines by which to decide on 1, and potentially, 2 and 3.
If you have anything to comment/add to the above, please propose your desired course of action.

3. Following 1 and 2, we either organise the hackathon, decide that it doesn't make sense for Offcourse to organize a hackathon (question 1) or that it's something that we *really really want* to do but can't due to lack of resources (question 2).

2. If the answer is YES, we have to figure out whether it's feasible to organise the hackathon. Here, we really need to know how much time it will cost us, what Mijke/Tamara and/or other partners are willing to invest. This is where we should put all of our efforts into making the hackathon possible.

1. Decide whether the hackathon is something that we *as Offcourse*, in an ideal world, want to organise. It should make business sense. Answer this question with a yes or no., without paying attention to limitations (hours, work load, problems...).
I believe that the course of action is:
Let's discuss the hackathon here! I hear that we're all discussing this communications separately, hope this will clarify things :slightly_smiling_face:
<@U8DQWL9EK> has joined the channel
<@U0D6EPESC> has joined the channel
set the channel description: To discuss the desirability and/or practicalities of the hackathon
